definitions.definition: In bookkeeping , an entry in the left hand column of an account .
examples: A cash sale is recorded as debit on the cash account and as credit on the sales account.

definitions.definition: A sum of money taken out of a bank account . Thus called, because in bank's bookkeeping a cash withdrawal diminishes the amount of money held on the account, i.e. bank's debt to the customer.

main_definition: In bookkeeping , an entry in the left hand column of an account .
secondary_definitions: A sum of money taken out of a bank account . Thus called, because in bank's bookkeeping a cash withdrawal diminishes the amount of money held on the account, i.e. bank's debt to the customer.
